name: Hotel Hermes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only 2 nights in the Italian summer and were very grateful for the well airconditioned, large and clean room. It was very close to the train station and there is only a few flights of stairs up to your room, with a landing along the way if you're struggling!
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly stay

likes.disliked: — Sewerage smell probably due to roadworks

reviews.text: On arrival, we were so impressed by the lovely personal letter written to us by Pat, the owner, apologising for not meeting us in person that night. She also invited us to a community event being held at San Lorenzo involving free pasta and watermelon!
reviews.title: A real bargain for a nice small hotel in central Florence

likes.liked: — Owner speaks English, very charming and helpful and the cost was a bargain.
likes.disliked: — No view outside the hotel, but view of a nice small patio instead.

reviews.text: We thoroughly appreciated Pat's travel advice and enthusiastic hospitality. She also makes a great cappuccino, and has lovely helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Perfect location, extremely helpful staff, excellent price

reviews.text: Unfortunately, the only down point to our stay, was the occasional waft of sewerage smell in our room. We believe that may have been due to the construction work occurring across from the hotel at that time.
reviews.title: Great Find

likes.liked: — The location is absolutely convenient to train, sites, eating.
likes.disliked: — No elevator, because I always take too much luggage.

reviews.text: We would certainly stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Happy at the Hermes
loved it!
reviews.text: It is a very clean, very nice home-feel hotel, with a very good location, just across from the train station. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. The owner is a very nice lady, who speaks english, italian, spanish and french, and she can tell u everything you need to know to get around florence! I had a great time! highly recemended!

Are you planning a trip to Florence and want something real "stepping"?! Hotel Hermes gave my father and me a wonderful "step" to everything!! It´s right a few steps from the train station, steps from the bus stop, steps from shops, restaurants, and you only have to climb a few steps" to enter into a very warm and charming place, with cozy details that Paty and Andrea Baglioni (owners) personally arranged for the tourist to feel at home.
reviews.title: Great , in every way!

likes.liked: — great personal attention! Awesome location! Great rates!
likes.disliked: — We only had few days to enjoy it!

reviews.text: My father and I made a month-trip to Europe last September, and we had the opportunity to stay in great hotels, but Hermes Hotel gave us not only a great stay, but a great "familiar environment". When you enter the Hotel, you receive smiles, the rooms are cozy, clean, comfortable ...even if they don´t have a restaurant, the coffe and bread served home-style is surrounded by laughs, chating, and gigglings.
reviews.title: Great Experience

likes.disliked: — Not the hotels fault, but the smell of the Florence water system...

reviews.text: It is a shame to know that the entrance has been blocked due to construction reasons, but eventhough, you should book the Hermes Hotel and you won´t regret it. We really had a great time and a very enjoyable stay, and look forward to come back soon.
reviews.title: Perfect for Florence sightseeing

likes.disliked: — a lot of stairs, but not too bad

reviews.text: We just returned from 3 days in Florence and the staff at Hotel Hermes made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel is centrally located, only 10-15 minute walk to almost any major attraction in the city. The owner pretty much mapped out our whole stay as well as suggested wonderful places to dine, which made our trip better than I could have imagined, and she was spot on with all her suggestions. If you are looking for a very reasonably priced hotel with clean rooms, free breakfast and a great staff...Hotel Hermes is the place. We made all our plans at info@hotelhermes.it
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Hermes is ideally located across the street from the train station (Santa Maria Novella) and down the street from the historic center of Florence. The Duomo (main cathedral) and the outdoor market at San Lorenzo are just down the street. The Ponte Vecchio (the old bridge), the Uffizi (art muesum) and the designer shops in Via Tournabouni are not much farther. Hermes is reasonably priced (remember, you are in Florence) and very clean. However, the service is what puts Hermes above the rest. The hotel owner is a remarkable woman whose knowledge of Florence will give you new insights into one of the most beautiful cities in the world. It is also convenient that her English and Spanish are perfect. Her French probably is too, but I don't speak French.
reviews.title: Amo (Love) Hotel Hermes!

reviews.text: Enjoy your stay! I always do!!
reviews.title: A Home at Hermes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Hermes is lovely, simple and very clean. The owner is perfectly fluent in English and Spanish, and is a true Florentine. I found myself on many an afternoon, perched on a stool in the cozy lobby, drinking cappuccino and practicing my Italian with the staff. Centrally located, Hotel Hermes is perfect for young people travelling alone - especially if your interests lie in getting to know the art and language of Florence, as the folks at Hotel Hermes are experts.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Hermes Hotel

description: Small 2 star (7rrooms with private bathroom and 7 which share 3 bathrooms) no frills family run hotel 50 mts. from the main SMN train station and within walking distance of all monuments, museums and historical sites. In Italian, English, French and Spanish we give our guests all the information required to make the best out of their visit to Florence and surrounding Tuscan cities. Cleanliness and cordiality are our priorities.
